meanings.definition: Capable of being understood or comprehended.
meanings.sent1: The story was so fathomable that even young children could follow along.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the math problem in a fathomable way for the students to grasp.
meanings.sent3: It was fathomable how the puppy managed to get stuck in such a small box.
meanings.sent4: Her fathomable explanation shed light on the complex topic.
meanings.sent5: The fathomable concept of gravity made sense to everyone in the class.

meanings.definition: Able to be measured in depth.
meanings.sent1: The lake was fathomable, allowing divers to explore its depths easily.
meanings.sent2: The ocean's fathomable depth amazed the researchers studying marine life.
meanings.sent3: It was fathomable how the shipwreck remained hidden for so long.
meanings.sent4: The fathomable abyss seemed to hold endless mysteries beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The fathomable trench revealed secrets of the underwater world.
